data.title: Via Alpina Switzerland â€“ Hut To Hut Hiking Switzerland
data.meta_description: Plan your Via Alpina self-guided hike across Switzerland and explore the diversity of the Alps on this epic journey, previously known as the Alpine Pass Route.
data.text:
The Via Alpina is Switzerlandâ€™s number one hiking route, taking you over the 14 most beautiful mountain passes in the country, leading through a variety of culture, geology, flora, and fauna. Itâ€™s the best way to get to know the Swiss Alpine culture.

Also called the Swiss Alpine Pass Route, it starts in its east at the border with Liechtenstein and continues across the whole country to the west â€” ending at Lake Geneva. As a well-maintained trail, it is a hikerâ€™s paradise.

It features 18 stages that require about 5-7 hours of walking per day to complete, but some can be shortened by the use of public transportation (cable cars and buses). It is less challenging technically than the Walkerâ€™s Haute Route, but fitness-wise it is quite similar.

To allow you to focus more on enjoying the trail and preparing for it on the physical side, we will take care of the logistical planning.

We take your wishes and preferences to best advise you on your perfect Via Alpina itinerary. We book all of your accommodations, organize luggage transfers, and more, so you can focus on the journey. And a few weeks before setting off, weâ€™ll send you the detailed itinerary booklet with the planned GPS route.
